Like others, I got a copyright infringement notice from Comcast from downloading this torrent.

For all of you guys who don't know how this kind of stuff happens, here it is.
Someone from some company that gives a shit about pirating downloads this torrent. Then, when they are downloading, they can see the seeder's info, including their IP address. Then they go find out that seeder's ISP and go tattle on them. Thus, the email.

So its not that you download too much, though if you are using tons of bandwidth that will probably attract attention, its because of that, up above.

FYI.

Let's get a couple of things straight:
Yes, you can be tracked for downloading this.
Peerblock doesn't necessarily help because it doesn't encrypt the data, it just blacklists certain known "Bad" computers. If you want real protection, use The Onion Router network, configurable in your Torrent client.

That's incorrect. Apart from the fact that the Tor network was not designed to handle P2P and can't be designed economically defendable to use P2P (someone has to pay the exit

servers), is that none of the clients are designed to use Tor. In Vuze it's an old relict before there was a change of developers.
blog torproject org/blog/bittorrent-over-tor-isnt-good-idea
If one wants anonimity -to a certain degree- you HAVE to pay or use I2P in which case the speed and availability takes a massive hit.
